question.body: Which of the three pairs of tonsils shown above are commonly referred to as the “adenoids” ?

response.feedback: Correct. The pharyngeal tonsils located in the nasopharynx are commonly called the adenoids.
Incorrect. The lingual tonsils are located on the base of the tongue and are named “lingual” in reference to their location on the tongue.
Incorrect. The palatine tonsils are located in the oropharynx and are visible when someone opens their mouth wide.

question.body: Which of the three pairs of tonsils shown above are commonly removed in during a tonsillectomy?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The pharyngeal tonsils can be removed in an adenoid removal surgery that may take place at the same time as the palatine tonsils which are removed in a tonsillectomy.
Incorrect. The lingual tonsils are located on the base of the tongue and are very rarely infected to the point that they need to be removed.
Correct. The palatine tonsils are located in the oropharynx and are visible when someone opens their mouth wide. These tonsils can become chronically inflamed and need to be removed.
